intro: Stachyococcus adinanthus, commonly known as the red-stemmed moss or red-stemmed cushion plant, is a small, mat-forming plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in high-altitude ecosystems.
